page.title: 05Conservation (12)
page.content: The{Moorpool}and{Calthorpe}housing estates both extend into the{S.E.}of the block. Both are{conservation areas , Moorpool(1970) and Calthorpe(1976), and consist of narrow, tree lined roads{not designed for motor cars (Moorpool Est. was built between 1908-12 without garages). Most houses are{detached or {semi-detached},owner-occupied with large gardens. They have{changed {little}because of the hard work of trusts set up to run the estates, and the residents society (Calthorpe). { Shops are small}eg.Post office/grocer and newsagent. On the Moorpool est. there is a tennis and snooker club and a Ladies circle and annual social events are held (Garden show).{Trees are being added to help add to a village or garden look .All changes require permission.
